info.name: 2020.10.23 - Autotask Collecction - Must fill in variables on collection
info.description:
This is a collection of Postman requests to assist you in learning about the Autotask PSA REST API. 
In order to simplify in using this you must update the Variables tab on the collection and enter into "Current Value" for each of the following:
    [1] Webservice string like "webservices2" or webservices15 or whichever zone your database is located.
    [2] ApiIntegrationCode - Provided to 3rd Party Vendors or Custom Tracking Identifier from Create API User  screen.
    [3] Api UserName you defined on the Create API User screen
    [4] Secret you defined on the Create API User screen.    

Some of these request will need to be updated to utilize the ID's and field information specific to your database in order to work. In most cases, issues with using these request are related to data specific to your database or the API user not having permissions to what is being test. These are for example and educational purposes only and there is no guarantee or warranty that they will always work. 

Please refer to on-line help on how to create an API user at
https://ww2.autotask.net/help/Content/AdminSetup/1FeaturesSettings/ResourcesUsers/Resources/API_User_Add_Edit.htm

Please refer to on-line help for REST documentation at
https://ww2.autotask.net/help/DeveloperHelp/Content/AdminSetup/2ExtensionsIntegrations/APIs/REST/REST_API_Home.htm

item.name: ZoneInformation (non-authenticated)

request.description:
Query User Zone Information 

The response should contain information similar to the following for the full username you specify.
{
    "zoneName": "Pre Release",
    "url": "https://webservices2.autotask.net/ATServicesRest/",
    "webUrl": "https://ww2.autotask.net/",
    "ci": 30595
}

See on-line help for more information.
https://ww2.autotask.net/help/DeveloperHelp/Content/AdminSetup/2ExtensionsIntegrations/APIs/REST/API_Calls/REST_ZoneInformation.htm

item.name: API Call Limits - ThresholdInformation

request.description:
To ensure an acceptable response time for all REST API users and prevent inadvertent coding errors from crippling the system, Autotask PSA sets a limit of 10,000 on the number of external requests allowed per hour between an individual database and all API activity.

Developers of the Autotask API should be aware of these limits and as all integrations on a customer database contribute to this limit so awareness and error handling to deal with high usage and exceeeded threshold are recommended. 

Please refer to on-line help for additional information.
https://ww2.autotask.net/help/DeveloperHelp/Content/AdminSetup/2ExtensionsIntegrations/APIs/REST/General_Topics/REST_Thresholds_Limits.htm?Highlight=threshold

item.name: Attachment Create to Ticket - Contact Impersonation

request.description:
Contact Impersonation requires 2 things:
    [1] Provide valid contact ID in attachedByContactID
    [2] Enable API User contact impresonation settings on copy of system API User security level.



Plese see on-line help for additional information on attachments.

https://ww2.autotask.net/help/DeveloperHelp/Content/AdminSetup/2ExtensionsIntegrations/APIs/REST/Entities/TicketAttachmentsEntity.htm

item.name: Update a ContactGroup
Patch Update a ContactGroup
Delete a ContactGroup
Webhooks - Step 1 - Create CompanyWebhooks

request.description:
Subscribing to webhooks has the following process.

    [1] Create Webhook (required)
    [2] Add at least 1 field to display or subscribe (required for Webhook to be ready). Display indicates to include in payload. Subscribe indicates to trigger when that field is changed in Autotask.
    [3] Add additional fields to display or subscribe.
    [4] Add resources to NOT trigger the webhook (exclude). The use case is often an integration executing a two way synchronization  doesn't need to trigger a webhook in Autotask to be told it just updated Autotask. This can help in avoiding an infinite notification loop between systems.

item.name: Webhooks - Step 2a -  Retrieve Field Information
